body:
I'll take it out even if it should not have much impact (because it's only in the rare path).

When feeding a size `(0,)` Tensor `(torch.cuda.FloatTensor([0])[1:]`), I still get the above message before I even take the size of the Tensor. I could imagine that something between python and ATen takes away 0-size dimensions because the function are historically unable to cope with empty dimensions or so, but I don't actually know. 

Best regards

Thomas
